message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: https://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/LinkedDatMeetupLondon/WebDeveloperAPILinkedData 

A web developer API for (Government) Linked data
simple publishing formats:
retain linked data roots-> how?
   remove round-tripping requirement
   represent rooted graph
Middle layer between the SPARQL endpiont and the web developer
project a rdf graph from a bigger one and show it to the web users
easier data access layer
it creates a new endpoint
first: select the data
second: "view" the data with describe
specify the endpoint
simple links specifying a view
in the url there are specified aset of contraints that are translated into a SPARQL query (I guess it considers the patterns specified in the config file) they are URL patterns
it can also include an ontology inthe URL for adding relationships
It is a bridge between SPARQL and a REST API
There is a google code project about this? purl.org/linked-data/api/spec
liked-data-api?
it is open source? configurable for other SPARQL endpoints?
it is possible to access CSV?
seems that it needs a good configuration
top questions, semantic overflow
speaker: SYSTEM
